column5: Way to go on the weight loss so far!
I‚Äôm really bad about this too. It‚Äôs like, we know what we should do... but doing it sucks! üòÇ I hear making small swaps at first can really help keep you going.
That‚Äôs a really good idea. And the reward at the end is a lasting one!
Man, I really need to work on my range of motion. I can‚Äôt even cross one leg over the other at this point. I need to start regularly stretching, too!

I‚Äôm so with you on this. I could probably stand to lose more like 150.. but I would be happy with 100 at this point. My chronic pain has made it near impossible these days. There was a time I pushed through it and got stronger and saw a good amount of progress... but then had a health setback and am back where I started. Except I‚Äôm a lot less motivated. I say we get a motivation chain going! Small progress each day. We can do this!

I‚Äôm trying to pay down my credit card debt. The interest is what‚Äôs killing me. I knew I was getting into a mess when it started, but we had just bought a house and had a lot of initial expenses, so I bit the bullet and have been trying to be responsible since then. I‚Äôm making slow progress, but I had a set back a couple years ago and basically lost a years worth of progress paying things down. I‚Äôm finally at a point where I consistently haven‚Äôt used my credit cards for over 6 months for anything at all and I‚Äôm just paying them down. I was doing really well with the snowball method last year and was able to pay off the card with the highest interest. It has remained paid off and I was working on the next one when the pandemic hit. I‚Äôm back to making minimum payments to avoid any financial uncertainties that may stem from this crisis, so my debt is shrinking much slower again... but it‚Äôs still going down and that‚Äôs what counts. 

My goal is to find more ways to tighten the belt so I can pay down the cards faster... this pandemic and working remotely has saved me tons of gas and lunch money. Now I just need to be better about not being wasteful or indulging myself so often.
Thank you. Just sharing my personal experiences in hopes it can help provide some perspective. üôÇ

I‚Äôm sure they knew. But when we brought her in as a TNR of a feral cat, they likely didn‚Äôt even think to mention it because they do those kind of procedures all the time. Overfilled shelter, population control, lack of resources... whatever the reason, they likely assumed nobody wanted to take responsibility for her so they just performed the procedure and noted it on the paperwork. We had had no idea, but the TNR program is just ‚Äúdrop them off first thing and pick them up end of the day‚Äù community service, not me personally taking my cat to a vet to have her looked at. It‚Äôs a well intentioned program, but there are a few drawbacks. Especially for those of us who would be willing to be more involved. She‚Äôs well taken care of here, but I‚Äôm sure they are used to animals that are just released back into the neighborhood and aren‚Äôt really cared for.

I‚Äôve cared for a feral colony where a mother cat lost a kitten rather suddenly at about 3 weeks old. She seemed to understand pretty quickly that the baby was gone and I guess you could say she did mourn at first. She spent most of the next two days going back and forth between taking care of her remaining kittens and guarding the spot where her baby died. Within a week, she was caught up with her other babies, though, and seemed fine. 

On the flip side of that, there was a cat on the property of the house we bought that we TNRed. We found out after the fact that she had been pregnant when they spayed her. (We were devastated.) when she woke up, she frantically wandered the house looking for her kittens. I think it broke her, honestly. To be spayed while her hormones were high and her mothers instinct so strong. It‚Äôs been 4 years and she still comes into the house about once a week, wanders through the whole place howling as if she‚Äôs looking for something, then goes back out to the yard. I don‚Äôt know if she will ever be the same.

I think a lot of the behaviors are instinctual. In the case of a singleton dying where there are other kittens to care for, I think momma cat moves on reasonably quickly once the scent of her kitten is gone.  They are even known to abandon a weakling if they believe it will die anyway or lessen the chance of survival of the other kittens. They aren‚Äôt savage, really. It‚Äôs just instinct. They learn different behaviors based on their environment. So if you take a feral cat and domesticate it, some of those instincts go away as they become dependent on us. They also may take cues from how we are behaving. So I think you gave her the day to see and be near the baby that died. I think removing it now is probably best. And once the kitten‚Äôs scent has disappeared (usually a few days) her focus will likely fix on the remaining litter mates.

I‚Äôm the only one left in my house that can still power through marathon binges. A season of a show in one day kind of binges. I used to be able to binge watch with the kids. Several years back, when she was still into watching tv, my youngest and I spent her whole spring break binging on Gilmore Girls. We finished the whole series in the week she was out of school. Now a days, I can barely get her to sit through three or four episodes at a time and she is on her phone through the majority of it. (sigh) 

It doesn‚Äôt stop me from finding stuff to watch, but I‚Äôm usually doing it alone.
I do! üòÅ

You guys what is it with people who feel the need to reply all to an all staff message and tell the whole organization about their own personal opinion of the message?! Ugh! There has been a string of emails this morning of people responding to a message about a staff person who used to work there and I swear nobody needs to know you can‚Äôt remember what they look like and keep confusing them with another staff person that the rest of us don‚Äôt know. Just.. WHY!?

I haven‚Äôt been productive yet this morning. I‚Äôm logged into work and waiting for my supervisor to finish his meeting that ran long so that we can have our meeting that will now run long. One thing I‚Äôve noticed about working remotely that has been a bigger challenge than anticipated... the fact that others expect you to just let them take up your time because they aren‚Äôt physically seeing that they have interrupted you. It‚Äôs annoying when part of your job is dependent on whether someone else does their job... because there‚Äôs nobody to hand hold the guy to hold him accountable so I‚Äôm doing a lot of waiting on others these days. 

It‚Äôs okay, though, I am passing the time here and working on my knitting project. So... keep wasting my time people. I get paid either way. üòÅ

Indoor blanket forts and lots of snacks while binging shows or movies.  In fact, I committed to watching a new movie I‚Äôve never seen every week. It‚Äôs been fun going through and picking stuff I normally wouldn‚Äôt have.

Treat yourself to a spa day... scented candles, long baths, deep conditioning, manicure/pedicure, wax and/or shave (if you‚Äôre into that sort of thing), try all those face masks, lotions, etc that are suppose to be good for your skin. 

Take on a challenge to learn something new... for me, I decided to challenge myself to learn anew knitting technique. My first attempt took a whole day and it was kind of a mess at the end, but I was proud of it anyway and am no longer scared to try something new that I thought would be too hard.

I made a list of shows or movies that are adaptations of a book and have been collecting the books to read before watching the movies.

Indoor scavenger hunt! 

Try making something out of the contents in the pantry.. you know the ones... they are in the back corner not getting used for anything because I‚Äôm too lazy to cook something elaborate. So I use a website (myfridgefood) and find a new recipe to try. Make a whole fancy meal and enjoy it like I‚Äôm at a restaurant trying a new food.

I feel you. This place has really brought a joyful distraction from the surrounding chaos. I hope getting to connect with your niece helps ease some of the heartache you feel being apart. It‚Äôs so hard when we can‚Äôt be with the ones we love. Sending you hugs!

One of my favorite things was watching a litter of kittens grow. This is such a cute stage!  The first time we gave soft food to the babies, one of them literally climbed onto the plate and laid on top of the food while he ate. Such a mess, but so adorable!

My hubby usually goes to work at 3 am and never wakes up to an alarm either. So I always wake up to make sure he gets to work on time. When we only had one car, I used to have to drop him off, too! Now, thankfully, he has his own vehicle. His work also cut hours so he doesn‚Äôt go in til 5:00 now so I get a couple more hours than I used to. I feel ya on the early rising/lots of coffee! The things we do for love ‚ù§Ô∏è
Oof! This has been happening to me too. Not all nighters, but laying awake at 2 am wondering why I am not tired. Have some extra coffee to get through the day. Hopefully you‚Äôll sleep well tonight!

Yay for coming off furlough! I‚Äôve been fortunate to be able to work from home since this started, but normally I work in an office, so the lack of access to my usual tools has been a struggle. Sounds like you‚Äôll be all set since you‚Äôre used to working from home. lucky!
I haven‚Äôt made anything at all! I feel so useless in the kitchen!

Oh no! I‚Äôve had the same thing happen before and it sucks when options are so limited because of lack of funds. We ended up buying a used one on credit just to have something and it barely lasted a year. So we ended up in the same boat again! Luckily the one we got the second time around seems to be holding up okay, but I still wish it weren‚Äôt so expensive to buy a new one that we know would last! 

I hope you‚Äôre able to find a solution! Living without a fridge sucks!

Been trying to avoid most social media because it infuriates me how many people care more about their entertainment than the safety of other people. It‚Äôs amazing how many people my husband deals with daily that complain about not being able to selfishly indulge. Most of them are of the attitude that if it‚Äôs not affecting them personally, it shouldn‚Äôt take away their privilege. I do t know how to tell someone to be a good person and think about others. üòî
HUGS!!! ü§ó Hang in there!
That sounds awesome! You‚Äôll have to let us know how it turns out!
Gotta improvise! If this has taught me one thing, it‚Äôs how to appreciate creative ways to indulge myself when I can‚Äôt go out. Have fun with it and enjoy the break!

We cared for a feral once that was a really fierce hunter. She found a bird‚Äôs next and pulled the whole thing into the middle of the parking lot of our apartments and was purposely smacking the baby birds around without really hurting them. They were just making a lot of noise. I was sure they were all going to be lunch, but it turned out she was using them as bait. When the mother bird tried to come to the rescue and started dive bombing her, she snatched the damn thing out of mid air and THAT was her lunch. She left the baby birds for some other cat. 

Feral cats are savage.
Some days be like that, tho. She will survive and not be worse for wear, I promise. Take care of you so you can take care of her. ‚ù§Ô∏è
Good luck! You got this!
So glad you‚Äôre feeling better today! Sending lots of hugs!! ‚ù§Ô∏è

You got this! My youngest just recently went through PHP and was pretty worried at first. She‚Äôs super introverted and doesn‚Äôt like to open up to strangers. It actually pulled something out of her, though, that seemed to reach a part of her we hadn‚Äôt before, so I think it was a positive experience. It wasn‚Äôt necessarily easy, of course. That‚Äôs a lot of time dedicated to your mental health. But her therapist called it therapy boot camp and that kind of fit the situation rather well. There was trust established pretty early on because the people running the program were specifically trained for troubled youth. And at the end of the program, they said she did a really awesome job and had confidence that she could work through her issues in the long run. 

Sending lots of hugs and support. It can be intense, but it will hopefully bring you some peace as well. üôèüèº

That‚Äôs so awesome. We have participated in the same thing locally Didn‚Äôt even know it existed til my hubby found a rock during one of our hikes. They had the website painted on the rock so we looked it up when we got home and saw how many people were participating and it sparked a ton of rock painting/hiding for a while. It was lots of fun! 

Congrats on the weight loss!

I‚Äôm so sorry it‚Äôs taking so long to navigate through all the red tape. It‚Äôs good you are keeping yourself busy with things you enjoy. But I know it can be frustrating to have to wait for answers. Sending you hugs!  I spent my day pretty much lazing around. I did a load of laundry, but haven‚Äôt folded it and put it away... I took out the trash and emptied the dishwasher, but didn‚Äôt wash any more dishes. I started to work on my blanket that I‚Äôm knitting, but didn‚Äôt get very far before I stopped because I couldn‚Äôt concentrate. I watched some tv, but didn‚Äôt really care about what I was watching. Kind of a blah day overall... but it‚Äôs better than the bad days I was having before, so I‚Äôll take it. Just trying not to think about all the things I should be doing and instead focus on one thing at a time and being proud of each thing. I tend to look at the list of what‚Äôs left to do and not take any joy from what is already done. Bad habit I developed before meds and therapy taught me how to avoid the downward spiral. I still slip, but I‚Äôm actively trying to be better about it. 

Now I‚Äôm laying in bed and can‚Äôt sleep for the 5th night in a row. At least working from home means I can roll out of bed and log onto my computer in my pjs! I plan to be minimally productive tomorrow and will probably do some coloring during my many conference calls. It‚Äôs my current zen moment that I consider pretty much the only self care I‚Äôve done this last week. I hope you take time for self care tomorrow. We all need to be gentle with ourselves sometimes. Do what nurtures your soul. It‚Äôs one of the best ways to not focus on things you can‚Äôt control. I hope you get good news soon.
